dt-api.name: row().child.show()
dt-api.summary: Make the child row(s) of a parent row visible

type.description: Show the child row(s) of a parent row

dt-api.description:
This method can be used to make the child rows of a parent row visible at any time. Child rows can be attached using `dt-api row().child()` but do not have to be made immediately visible. This method provides the option of making those child rows which have already been attached visible.
Unlike many of the other methods which manipulate the DataTable, this method does not require `dt-api draw()` to be called immanently after. The child row(s) are inserted into the table without requiring that DataTables redraw.

example.title: Create detail rows initially, but don't show them until the row is clicked upon
